sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: You decided to come here when you told me it’s going to be a great date?

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: We could have gone anywhere else you know. Well this was where we went on our first date so you get a pass.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: It’s not a date. I didn’t say that. You said that.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: Well it is a date. Usually, you just drag me somewhere unimportant just to say something like ‘cool’ or ‘dayum’.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: This time, for some unknown reason, you didn’t drag me and actually start by asking.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: That character development should’ve happened 20 years ago.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: What? I ask every now and then, right? Like every time I ask you to just add three sugar cubes and not four to my coffee.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Or when I ask you to open the window when bees get inside.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: And you never call a mistake ‘Mistake’, you call them ‘Unintentionally postponed success.’ Just say what it is, Will. It is what it is..

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: It’s not a date.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: Ugh, okay.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: So what are we doing here?

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: I don’t know. Maybe just sit down here for a while.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: They stay here for a while. No one said anything. They are not alone as there are many people in the park.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: But at the moment everyone does not matter, it is as if they are the only one there and Will started a conversation that will make that day very special.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Anna...

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: What?

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: You see. I’ve been sitting down here every now and then, because sitting here makes me think about a lot of things.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Things like work for example. At first I would gladly do overtime and try to get promoted as quickly as possible.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: But nowadays, I don’t have any motivation to do so.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Even though i’m sure i’m nearing a promotion at work, I just leave at five and a lot of times I sit here before going home.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: So, I’ve been thinking. If I work really, really hard. And then get promoted.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: And then start working really, really hard again. And then get promoted again.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: And then, if possible, someday, i reach some kind of peak where i no longer need to do anything anymore and just... live off my years of hard work--

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: That’s good, right?

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Yeah maybe, But if I don't enjoy it? Then . . . what is the point?

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: So I want to have some kind of purpose. If I have a purpose, then even laying down here is no longer pointless.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: What kind of purpose do you want?

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: I don’t know... To be honest, I don’t have anything I really want to do.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: So... you need to find something that you want?

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Yeah... I guess. In the past, I really wanted to work and get some money for myself. But now..., it’s become like brushing my teeth. I just do it.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: I feel like we are just circling around now. . .

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: What I'm saying is... I've been laying down here every day

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: If I think about it. I don’t have any purpose. There’s nothing I really want to do..

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: So I just live a life with no purpose. That is if it’s just me alone, but if it’s for other people. . .  then maybe I'll find a purpose.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: So you want to live for other people?

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Yeah.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: So you want to become like a firefighter. . . or something like that?

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: No, not like that. Just... one person is enough.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: So someone? Like who?

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Yeah for you. If it’s with you I think I can find a purpose

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: What?

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Huh?

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: So like... you want to live for me? What... is this marriage proposal, or something...

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: It’s not. I didn’t say that. You said that.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: Well what is it then? Sometimes you have to say this kind of stuff clearly, you know?

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Alright. . . alright, you know that I'm bad at this kind of thing right? It is as you said, anyway what I mean is . . . Will you marry me, Anna?

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: Will takes a ring from his pocket and shows it to Anna . Anna was surprised but a little while after she let out a little laugh.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: Hahaha. See, you can do it if you try. Even though it is soo sooo uncool. But my answer is yes. Of course, I will marry you Will.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: Will then put the ring on Anna's ring finger. They hugged and then kissed, afterwards they saw one another and laughed happily.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: That’s not the start of their story. That’s only one of many big milestones in their life.
